Activity: Log in, check emails and company communication channels (Slack/Teams). Catch up on any overnight developments or urgent requests.
Initial brainstorming session: High-level server architecture. Consider options like microservices vs. monolithic, cloud vs. on-premise. Document initial thoughts.

Research technology options for server backend. Evaluate languages (Go, Python, Java, C#), frameworks (Spring Boot, .NET Core, Express.js), and infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP). Prioritize based on performance, scalability, and security.
Contact @lpro-1 and @sdes-1 via email to schedule a meeting to discuss the proposed server architecture and technology stack. Subject: Server Architecture and Tech Stack Discussion
Lunch break. Browse tech news websites for interesting articles on server architecture and security best practices.
Meeting with @lpro-1 and @sdes-1 to discuss server architecture, technology stack, and potential challenges. Gather input and address concerns.
Refine the server architecture document based on the meeting feedback. Create a detailed diagram illustrating the different components and their interactions.

Research database options. Evaluate relational (PostgreSQL, MySQL) vs. NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) based on game data requirements (player profiles, game state, etc.). Consider scalability, consistency, and performance.
